articles.title: A close-in giant planet escapes engulfment by its star - Nature.com
articles.description: The giant planet 8 Ursae Minoris b seems to have avoided engulfment by its giant host star through a stellar merger that either affected the evolution of the host star or produced 8 Ursae Minoris b as a second-generation planet.

articles.title: Continuous synthesis of E. coli genome sections and Mb-scale human DNA assembly - Nature.com
articles.description: BAC stepwise insertion synthesis (BASIS) can be used to build synthetic genomes for diverse organisms, and continuous genome synthesis (CGS) enables the rapid synthesis of entire Escherichia coli genomes from functional designs.
